review: I have numerous Roku devices and was in the market to replace one of the original generation Roku boxes that doesn’t support all the channels currently available.  When I saw the special deal for the Amazon streaming stick its launch, it was too good to pass up.It is very similar to the Roku stick in setup and ease of use, but doesn’t have as many of the second tier channels as the Roku.  I assume this will improve over time.  The first couple of days it did need to be restarted several times when it froze adding a channel or game, but has been very stable ever since.All things being equal, I would probably choose the Roku stick because of my familiarity with it and the flow of the home page, but at the introductory price, the Amazon stick is a much better value and does everything I use my Roku stick for (primarily Netflix, Amazon, YouTube and Watch ESPN) equally as well and perhaps a bit faster.  Overall, I am very satisfied with the purchase.
author: jerlaul

review: I am going to go the other direction from the detailed reviews and try to be as brief as possible.The Fire TV Stick is a very capable device, similar to a Google Chromecast HDMI Streaming Media Player or Roku 3500R Streaming Stick (HDMI). The setup is plug and play. The interface is clean and easy to navigate with the included remote.Though the Fire TV Stick has applications for Showtime, Netflix, etc., one quickly realizes that it is primarily targeted to customers with an Amazon Prime subscription. There is no web browser nor any native applications for YouTube, HBO Go, Starz or Cinemax.Casting and Screen Mirroring is only supported for Android devices which further reduces usability. Chromecast supports both, Andorid and iOS, platforms.If you were lucky to get it for half-price and have an Amazon Prime subscription, this is a good way to access your content - especially with the easy to use remote. If not, I would recommend the Chromecast.Pros:* Attractive entry price* Easy to setup* Everything required for setup included in the box* Amazing picture quality - upto 1080P* Remote is a welcome accessory* Includes this $20, 1 Amp/5 Watt, wall charger - Amazon Kindle 5W USB Power AdapterCons:* Primarily targeted for Amazon Prime customers* Most audio/video/gaming content requires payment or subscription* No web browser* Casting and mirroring only supported for Android devices* Popular services like HBO Go, STARZ, Cinemax, etc. not supported* Power cable, due to a bad power slot design (on the side of the unit) interferes with other HDMI cables - especially when you have side-by-side HDMI slots. The included HDMI extension does alleviate this issue

review: I picked one of these up during the preorder sale for Prime members for $19.  I already own two Apple TVs, which are my primary streaming boxes for each of my televisions.  However, being a prime member, and the only real way to watch on Apple TV is with Airplay.  It works, but it also ties up power on your mobile device.  For $19, I figured why not.It arrived on Saturday and I had some real issues with initial setup, mostly related to WiFi reception.  I couldn't get a signal at all with the stick plugged into a side HDMI port, having 'Connect to your network' and a blank screen shown.  Eventually I brought it to my other television near my router, and quickly logged on, but then it took about 5 tries for the required software update.  After the update, the stick worked great downstairs, but still dropped reception upstairs.  FWIW, my Apple TV never has connection spots and my phone gets full WiFi in the same spot.Eventually I tried one of the back ports, and bam - working fine.  Probably some shielding of the signal on the side ports, so take that to heart.So, after jumping through some hoops on setup, I finally had it working, and overall, it's quite good.  The interface is clean, streaming quality is good, the remote works very well and there's a lot of great options.  Set up Plex and it works very well streaming my personal media to the Fire stick.Downsides are an inability to search just within Prime TV and Movies.  But for the price, it's hard to beat.  A very good streaming device, especially for the money.

review: It took about 30 minutes to set up. I had to unplug and restart twice for the download to complete. Once set up very easy to use but while watching a movie it will get stuck on buffering and say no connection when the connection is fine. So again I had to unplug and restart to watch the whole thing which I've never had to do on my iPad or computer. Also if you pause for too long (e.g. I had to run upstairs to check on my baby and put him back to sleep which took about 15 minutes) the movie would not restart and I had to unplug and restart. I think if they can work out the bugs it will be amazing. I still think it's a great value.
